intro: Burdachia prismatocarpa var. prismatocarpa, commonly known as the prism-seeded burdachia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, prism-shaped seeds that give it its common name. Its leaves are typically palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it produces showy, yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
